QuestionJSON.Question: Current, a gymnastics enthusiast, has been watching the sport evolve over the years. They noticed that there has been a drastic change in scoring methodology with the introduction of a computerized scoring system. The system considers not just the completion of the exercise, but also the complexity of the technique and the level of execution. What was a significant influence of the integration of this computer technology in Gymnastics?
QuestionJSON.Answer1: The athletes started focusing only on perfecting the landing of each technique to maximize their score.
QuestionJSON.Answer2: The athletes started exploring more complex techniques in their routines to score higher.
QuestionJSON.Answer3: The athletes started delivering crowd-pleasing performances that had less complex techniques but more aesthetics.
QuestionJSON.Answer4: The athletes started lobbying for their scores to be based on their personal records and not just one performance.
QuestionJSON.Explanation: The introduction of the computerized scoring system placed more emphasis on the complexity of the techniques and the level of execution. As a result, athletes, to maximize their scores, started incorporating more complex techniques in their routines. This was a significant shift in the sport, introducing more challenging and innovative techniques.
